chat.msg: Welcome!
hello
Hello! Welcome to the game. Are you ready to navigate the map?
yes i am

Great! Let's get started. You are currently standing at the top-right corner of the map, next to a white dog. 

Your first step is to go left (west), keeping the dog on your right side. Can you describe what you see as you move in that direction?
i can not see anything
Hmm, let's try again. Walk a few steps to your left and let me know if you see anything along the way.

chat.msg: Welcome!
hello
Hello! I am the navigator. I am currently at the starting point, which is a tent at the north of the map. What can I do for you?
i want to know how i can go about
Certainly! Please let me know what direction I should take first. Should I head south, east, west, or north?
take south
are you there?
Understood! I am now south of the dog and the fire. I see a red mushroom to the right of the fire and a blue car to the south of the mushroom. What should be my next move?

chat.msg: Welcome!
hello
Hello! Are you ready to begin our navigation game?
yes,i am
Great! Let's start. Look around you and describe what you see near the group of three palm trees.
i am seeing a dog, 3 purple dots and a yellow dot

Hmm, interesting! It seems like there might be a little confusion. Instead of a dog, do you see a brown puppy near the palm trees? Let's focus on the path first. From the group of three palm trees, go under the first tree, towards the southwest. Let me know when you're there.
yes i can see a puppy
Perfect! Now, facing the puppy, turn right and walk straight, crossing the second palm tree. Once you pass it, make a sharp left turn. Let me know when you've made the turn.
i have done that
Great job! Now, as you continue southward, you'll come across a big rock on your left side and a small rock on your right side. Walk between them. Let me know when you're there.
i just walked through them

Fantastic! You're doing great so far. Now, ahead of you, you'll see the ocean or some other body of water. Enter the water and face a large red crab. Once you're facing the crab, turn right and continue moving west along the big rock. Let me know when you're facing the crab and turned right.
yes i just turned right

Well done! Now, continue along the big rock in the water and pass a third medium-sized rock. As you do, you'll notice a shark in the water. Make a sharp turn to the right to avoid it. Let me know when you've made the turn.

general_survey.question: Have you ever lived in a home environment or country where your second language was spoken? If so, please explain briefly:
On a day-to-day basis, how likely are you to have a conversation using both your first and second languages?
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At work
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At home
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with friends
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with family
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Using social media
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? To accommodate people who don't share the same language or language fluency.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? For social reasons; one language feels more appropriate.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I can't think of a word in the current language.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? The word in the other language just fits better.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? It's an accident, or I don't realize I'm doing it.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I'm more comfortable discussing the topic in the other language.
Do you enjoy mixing languages in conversation?

general_survey.answer: i think it is there choice and most times, it happens by mistake.
